revised_title: Chemical Analysis and Observations of Buxton and Matlock Waters
tldr: The author, Thomas Percival, conducted experiments on the waters of Buxton and Matlock in Derbyshire, analyzing their chemical composition and properties. He found that Buxton water contains a heating quality and mineral spirit, while Matlock water is slightly impregnated with earthly salts and has a pleasant taste and temperature. Percival also discussed the potential health benefits and precautions when using these waters for spa treatments.
